newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani stocks end lower, seen range-bounded.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani stocks end lower, seen range-bounded.

text.p: Pakistani stocks finished lower on Sunday in dull trading, and dealers said gloomy political and economic scenario was likely to keep the market range-bounded on Monday, the new accounts day.

The Karachi Stock Exchange (KSE) 100-share index fell 7.43 points, or 0.51 percent, to end at 1,442.12. Losers led gainers 133 to 70. Turnover fell to 18.54 million shares from 30.08 million in the previous session on Thursday.
"The market is moving on technicals alone," dealer Sajjad Mankani at BMA Capital Management said, adding that there was no news to attract major players into the market.
